SEARCH
Package homework1

Class GeoFeature

java.lang.Object
homework1.GeoFeature
public class GeoFeature extends Object
A GeoFeature represents a route from one location to another along a single geographic feature. GeoFeatures are immutable.

GeoFeature abstracts over a sequence of GeoSegments, all of which have the same name, thus providing a representation for nonlinear or nonatomic geographic features. As an example, a GeoFeature might represent the course of a winding river, or travel along a road through intersections but remaining on the same road.

GeoFeatures are immutable. New GeoFeatures can be constructed by adding a segment to the end of a GeoFeature. An added segment must be properly oriented; that is, its p1 field must correspond to the end of the original GeoFeature, and its p2 field corresponds to the end of the new GeoFeature, and the name of the GeoSegment being added must match the name of the existing GeoFeature.

Because a GeoFeature is not necessarily straight, its length - the distance traveled by following the path from start to end - is not necessarily the same as the distance along a straight line between its endpoints.

The following fields are used in the specification: 

   start : GeoPoint       // location of the start of the geographic feature
   end : GeoPoint         // location of the end of the geographic feature
   startHeading : angle   // direction of travel at the start of the geographic feature, in degrees
   endHeading : angle     // direction of travel at the end of the geographic feature, in degrees
   geoSegments : sequence       // a sequence of segments that make up this geographic feature
   name : String          // name of geographic feature
   length : real          // total length of the geographic feature, in kilometers

    • getStartHeading

      public double getStartHeading()
      Returns direction of travel at the start of the geographic feature.
      Returns:
      direction (in standard heading) of travel at the start of the geographic feature, in 0 invalid input: '<'= degrees invalid input: '<' 360. if degrees = 360 start and end point are the same point and the direction will not change.

    • getEndHeading

      public double getEndHeading()
      Returns direction of travel at the end of the geographic feature.
      Returns:
      direction (in standard heading) of travel at the end of the geographic feature, in 0 invalid input: '<'= degrees invalid input: '<' 360. if degrees = 360 start and end point are the same point.

    • getLength

      public double getLength()
      Returns total length of the geographic feature, in kilometers.
      Returns:
      total length of the geographic feature, in kilometers. NOTE: this is NOT as-the-crow-flies, but rather the total distance required to traverse the geographic feature. These values are not necessarily equal.

    • addSegment

      public GeoFeature addSegment(GeoSegment gs)
      Creates a new GeoFeature that is equal to this GeoFeature with gs appended to its end.
      Returns:
      a new GeoFeature r such that r.end = gs.p2 invalid input: '&'invalid input: '&' r.endHeading = gs.heading invalid input: '&'invalid input: '&' r.length = this.length + gs.length
      Requires:
      gs != null invalid input: '&'invalid input: '&' gs.p1 = this.end invalid input: '&'invalid input: '&' gs.name = this.name.

    • getGeoSegments

      public Iterator<GeoSegment> getGeoSegments()
      Returns an Iterator of GeoSegment objects. The concatenation of the GeoSegments, in order, is equivalent to this GeoFeature. All the GeoSegments have the same name.
      Returns:
      an Iterator of GeoSegments such that 
            this.start        = a[0].p1 invalid input: '&'invalid input: '&'
      this.startHeading = a[0].heading invalid input: '&'invalid input: '&'
      this.end          = a[a.length - 1].p2 invalid input: '&'invalid input: '&'
      this.endHeading   = a[a.length - 1].heading invalid input: '&'invalid input: '&'
      this.length       = sum(0 invalid input: '<'= i invalid input: '<' a.length) . a[i].length invalid input: '&'invalid input: '&'
      for all integers i
          (0 invalid input: '<'= i invalid input: '<' a.length-1 => (a[i].name == a[i+1].name invalid input: '&'invalid input: '&'
                                   a[i].p2d  == a[i+1].p1))
      where a[n] denotes the nth element of the Iterator.
      See Also:
      • GeoSegment
